meanings.sent1: The audience reacclaims the talented singer after her performance.
meanings.sent2: The teacher reacclaims the student for his hard work on the project.
meanings.sent3: The cat reacclaims the same spot on the windowsill every sunny afternoon.
meanings.sent4: The old book reacclaims its popularity as readers rediscover its charm.
meanings.sent5: The town reacclaims its historic theater, celebrating its reopening with joy.

meanings.definition: To give praise or recognition again.
meanings.sent1: The company reacclaims the employee for his dedication to the job.
meanings.sent2: The community reacclaims the local hero for his selfless actions.
meanings.sent3: The child reacclaims the same toy car every time he visits his friend's house.
meanings.sent4: The sun reacclaims the sky after a storm, shining brightly once again.
meanings.sent5: The artist reacclaims her masterpiece, receiving new accolades for its beauty.
